resources.string: Depending on [i]Question Style[/i], we speak the question or show it in the first coloured field (blue for English, red for Spanish); 2nd field is a hint if relevant; 3rd field is for the answer. Think of your answer and press Go; we will fill in the correct answer and you then tell us if you got it right or not. If you are not sure of the spelling, you can type in the answer and we will mark it for you; self-mark mode only applies if the answer field is blank. If you want to check your Spanish pronunciation and you have Wi-Fi, you can press the microphone button and speak the answer; we will use Google speech recognition to try to decipher what you are saying. [a]HomeHelp|Home[/a] Open main menu: left swipe from side of screen, or press on arrow at top left of screen.
 Select [i]Questions by Level[/i]
 Follow the instructions in blue
 Most of the time you should think of answer, not type it; for further info see [a]SelfMarkHelp|Self-Marking[/a]
 Spanish has several words for [i]you[/i]; to differentiate in English we use [i]thou[/i] for the familiar, and [i]YOU[/i] for the plural.

[a]HomeHelp|Home[/a] Each level consists of 10 words or phrases from the dictionary; we will randomly ask you words from 3 categories: the current level; any previous level; words failed at this level or the previous level. If you get a word wrong it is added to the list of fails; we will ask you the failed word again until you get it right twice consecutively. You move to the next level when you have answered all the 10 words and cleared all the fails. Fails are also carried on to the next level, where they need to be answered correctly once more.

[a]HomeHelp|Home[/a] QuestionStyle allows you to choose from questions in Spanish, answers in English, or vice versa; the question can be spoken or printed. When the answer is in Spanish, you can practice your pronunciation by pressing the Mic button, and speaking the answer; this requires internet access as it uses Google speech recognition.

[a]HomeHelp|Home[/a] Many words and phrases in the dictionary are given a topic: e.g. food, travel hobby. You can choose words from a specific topic; this is then similar to [a]QuestionsByLevelHelp|Questions by level[/a], except that current now refers to your selected topic, i.e. we will randomly ask you questions from topic, any previous level and failed words.

[a]HomeHelp|Home[/a] We have put a lot of love and care into this App, because we also love learning Spanish. We want you to enjoy this App as much as we enjoy playing with it ourselves. Everyone is different, and there are many different learning styles. If you have any comments or suggestions for improving this App, please send an email to amazemequiz@gmail.com

[a]HomeHelp|Home[/a] Because keyboards are usually small and fiddly, and most of us are not brilliant typists, we realised the learning process could be sped up considerably if you didn\'t have to type the answer. So you think of your answer (or if the answer is Spanish, ideally speak it aloud), press [i]GO[/i], and we will supply the answer. You then check if you were right - or at least close enough. If you mark yourself wrong, that word will appear again shortly; in fact you won\'t progress to the next level until you have got it right twice consecutively; just to make sure, we will ask you it again at the next level.

[a]HomeHelp|Home[/a] Listen to the numbers spoken in Spanish, and type in that number; if you get the number correct, your blue man will move forward; if the red man reaches the end before you, you have lost; if you get to the end before him, you go back to the beginning at the next level, where the red man gets slightly faster, and the questions get slightly harder. If you get caught, you can still continue to answer questions, but you will stay at the same level.

[a]HomeHelp|Home[/a] Type in a word, either Spanish or English, and press [i]Go[/i] on the soft keyboard. If the word is a verb, the full conjugation will be shown; otherwise we show the definition of that word from the dictionary. Press [i]back[/i] button to return to the main screen, or swipe in from the left for the main menu. If you supply a word in both the Spanish and English fields, we assume you want the Spanish one translated.
